result.execSummary:
The defendant Perry M. Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

01:54 PM 16CM184, 17CF109, 17CF111, 17CM87, 18CF32, and 18CF132. Defendant Perry M. Phillips in court, with Atty McDougal with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty McDougal states there is a resolution and puts on the record. Def pleads NC to all counts. 

Court Orders:

16CM164:
Count 1- 5 days in county jail that will begin today, Huber granted, $350 plus costs, 1 year revocation, 1 year IID, AODA. 1 day credit.
Count 2-4 are dismissed and read in.

17CF109:
Count 2: 60 days jail,imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. 15 days credit.
Count 1: Dismissed and read in.

17CF111:
Count 1: Repeater dismissed, PSI ordered, due by March 8th.
Count 3-5: Dismissed and read in. 

17CM87:
Count 2: 6 months in county jail, imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. 4 days credit. 
Count 1: Dismissed and read in. 

18CF32:
Count 1: PSI ordered, due by March 8th.
Count 2-4 dismissed and read in.

18CF132 is dismissed and read in. 

Conditions of Probation: Obey rules and regulations of probation, attend, pay for, and succesfully complete any programming recommended by agent, costs waived.
